pageContext.description: The Virgin is shown seated at the centre of the image, wearing a red dress and a blue cloak. She holds the infant Christ with her right hand. He stands on her lap and is about to place a grape in her mouth, taken from the bunch held by the Virgin in her left hand. The background is dark.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 77.7 x 57.1 cm
[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-british-paintings-evening-l13036/lot.25.html?locale=en; accessed 20-03-2019]

[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-british-paintings-evening-l13036/lot.25.html?locale=en; accessed 20-03-2019]

metadata.title: Virgin and Child with a Bunch of Grapes

pageContext.provenance:
- with Pico Cellini Gallery, Rome, 1959
- Munich art market, 1967
- acquired there or soon after by Friedrich Flick (1883-1972)
- bequeathed by the above to the grandfather of the former owner
- 04.12.2013 sold by Sotheby's, London
[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-british-paintings-evening-l13036/lot.25.html?locale=en; accessed 20-03-2019]
pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia at the right, centre: serpent with dropped wings, facing left; in yellow paint
[cda 2019]
